email¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

get_full_name()[source]¶

Function that returns string representation of user full name.

get_short_name()[source]¶

Function that returns string representation of user name.

groups¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

id¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

last_login¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

logentry_set¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

name¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

user_permissions¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

class accounts.models.UserAccountManager(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: django.contrib.auth.base_user.BaseUserManager

This class is responsible for creating all types of user accounts.

create_superuser(email, name, password)[source]¶

This function is responsible for creating admin superuser.

Parameters

  • email (string) – email id

  • name (string) – admin name

  • password (string) – account password

Returns

list of user’s name, email, password

Return type

user object

create_user(email, name, password=None)[source]¶

This function is responsible for creating normal users.

Parameters

  • email (string) – email id

  • name (string) – username

  • password (string, optional) – account password, defaults to None

Raises

ValueError – if email id is not entered

Returns

list of user’s name, email, password

Return type

user object
